result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle L Monheim was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued. Pay supervision fees. Court set restitution at zero.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
No contact with victim. Third party contact allowed only for the child.

Complete batterer's intervention program if deemed necessary by the agent.
Mental health evaluation.
Complete parenting program. 
Comply with all orders and/or rules from the Bureau of Child Welfare and/or Children's Court.
Provide a DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: STAYED pending a review on May 20, 2016.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle L Monheim

records.addlTxt: Probation Status Review from DOC agent, received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Court ordered no contact order modified to no violent contact order with victim.

Defendant Michelle L Monheim in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Angela D. Cunningham appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for probation review hearing.  DOC agent also in court.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Probation agent is asking for additional time before holding a hearing.  The probation review hearing date of 05/20/2016 is rescheduled to 06/17/2016 at 01:30 p.m..
cab

Defendant Michelle L Monheim in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI  

Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  

As to Count 2:

Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 20 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program if deemed necessary by the agent.
- Mental health evaluation.
- Complete parenting program. 
- No contact with victim. Third party contact allowed only for the child. 
- Comply with all orders and/or rules from the Bureau of Child Welfare and/or Children's Court. 
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Provide DNA sample.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for May 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Michelle L Monheim
Current: 5781 S. Packard Ave. #13, Cudahy, WI 53110 United States  (Effective: 03-22-2016)
Prior: 2558 South 12th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215

Defendant Michelle L Monheim in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Micha Schwab appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Received and filed:
State's Witness List.
Defendant wants to change her plea.
.
As to count 2:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to count 1:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 1 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
Jury trial date of 03/28/16 vacated.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Michelle L Monheim in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija. Sara Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defendant counsel is in court to request that the court modify the court order to allow contact with her child.  Arguments heard.
The court will allow third party contact supervised, through CPS, if CPS allows it.

Per request of Attorney Lieja, this case is calendared for a bail review on 02/10/2016 at 01:30 p.m. in Branch 36.
Defense counsel has notified the district attorney and her client.
cab

Defendant Michelle L Monheim in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel is requesting a final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 36.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact/No Firearms Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.S.H. (3/18/90) or his child.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Michelle L Monheim in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Michelle L Monheim in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Protasiewicz.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Kremers, Br. 36.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
